attributes.action: end expenses corruption by devolution to Scotland, Wales, England, N.Ireland
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Some UK MPs and Cabinet Ministers have been enriching themselves with non-essential expenses, and forgotten their duty to good office, and prudent use of our taxes, during dificult economic times.

After the English Civil War, the House of Lords was briefly abolished for corruption.

As there is no smear on the devolved  assemblies / parliaments, full devolution immediately (for at least a year) is appropriate, until a joint government has been formed and  constituencies have deselected bad MPs, who otherwise unfairly have another year to run.  Then a general election can be held in each country.

    Treaty is inheritable, nations will still be within Europe, and citizens can relocate and work.
attributes.creator_name: Neil Humphrey, Lord Protector of England during Magna Carta breach 04-1036

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament: http://www.parliament.uk/
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
